listitem.para: Whether or not to allow IKE fragmentation. Valid values are are yes, (the default), no or force.

IKE fragmentation capablities are negotiated via vendor id. If pluto does not receive the FRAGMENTATION vendor id, no IKE fragments will be sent, regardless of the ike_fraa=g setting. When set to yes, IKE fragmentation will be attempted on the first re-transmit of an IKE packet of a size larger then 572 bytes for IPv4 and 1280 bytes for IPv6. If ike_frag is set to force, IKE fragmentation is used on initial transmits of such sized packets as well. When we have received IKE fragments for a connection, pluto behaves as if in force mode.
